00046 #define HAL( FUNCTION, ... ) pnd->last_error = 0; \
00047   if (pnd->driver->FUNCTION) { \
00048     return pnd->driver->FUNCTION( __VA_ARGS__ ); \
00049   } else { \
00050     pnd->last_error = NFC_EDEVNOTSUPP; \
00051     return false; \
00052   }

00054 #ifndef MIN
00055 #define MIN(a,b) (((a) < (b)) ? (a) : (b))
00056 #endif
00057 #ifndef MAX
00058 #define MAX(a,b) (((a) > (b)) ? (a) : (b))
00059 #endif
00060 
00061 /*
00062  * Buffer management macros.
00063  *
00064  * The following macros ease setting-up and using buffers:
00065  * BUFFER_INIT (data, 5);      // data -> [ xx, xx, xx, xx, xx ]
00066  * BUFFER_SIZE (data);         // size -> 0
00067  * BUFFER_APPEND (data, 0x12); // data -> [ 12, xx, xx, xx, xx ]
00068  * BUFFER_SIZE (data);         // size -> 1
00069  * uint16_t x = 0x3456;        // We suppose we are little endian
00070  * BUFFER_APPEND_BYTES (data, x, 2);
00071  *                             // data -> [ 12, 56, 34, xx, xx ]
00072  * BUFFER_SIZE (data);         // size -> 3
00073  * BUFFER_APPEND_LE (data, x, 2, sizeof (x));
00074  *                             // data -> [ 12, 56, 34, 34, 56 ]
00075  * BUFFER_SIZE (data);         // size -> 5
00076  */
00077 
00078 /*
00079  * Initialise a buffer named buffer_name of size bytes.
00080  */
00081 #define BUFFER_INIT(buffer_name, size) \
00082   uint8_t buffer_name[size]; \
00083   size_t __##buffer_name##_n = 0
00084 
00085 /*
00086  * Create a wrapper for an existing buffer.
00087  * BEWARE!  It eats children!
00088  */
00089 #define BUFFER_ALIAS(buffer_name, origin) \
00090   uint8_t *buffer_name = (void *)origin; \
00091   size_t __##buffer_name##_n = 0;
00092 
00093 #define BUFFER_SIZE(buffer_name) (__##buffer_name##_n)
00094 
00095 #define BUFFER_CLEAR(buffer_name) (__##buffer_name##_n = 0)
00096 /*
00097  * Append one byte of data to the buffer buffer_name.
00098  */
00099 #define BUFFER_APPEND(buffer_name, data) \
00100   do { \
00101     buffer_name[__##buffer_name##_n++] = data; \
00102   } while (0)
00103 
00104 /*
00105  * Append size bytes of data to the buffer buffer_name.
00106  */
00107 #define BUFFER_APPEND_BYTES(buffer_name, data, size) \
00108   do { \
00109     size_t __n = 0; \
00110     while (__n < size) { \
00111       buffer_name[__##buffer_name##_n++] = ((uint8_t *)data)[__n++]; \
00112     } \
00113   } while (0)
00114 
00115 typedef enum {
00116   NOT_INTRUSIVE,
00117   INTRUSIVE,
00118   NOT_AVAILABLE,
00119 } scan_type_enum;

00133   int (*initiator_select_dep_target)(struct nfc_device *pnd, const nfc_dep_mode ndm, const nfc_baud_rate nbr, const nfc_dep_info *pndiInitiator, nfc_target *pnt, const int timeout);
00134   int (*initiator_deselect_target)(struct nfc_device *pnd);

00137   int (*initiator_transceive_bytes_timed)(struct nfc_device *pnd, const uint8_t *pbtTx, const size_t szTx, uint8_t *pbtRx, const size_t szRx, uint32_t *cycles);
00138   int (*initiator_transceive_bits_timed)(struct nfc_device *pnd, const uint8_t *pbtTx, const size_t szTxBits, const uint8_t *pbtTxPar, uint8_t *pbtRx, uint8_t *pbtRxPar, uint32_t *cycles);
00139   int (*initiator_target_is_present)(struct nfc_device *pnd, const nfc_target *pnt);

00143   int (*target_receive_bytes)(struct nfc_device *pnd, uint8_t *pbtRx, const size_t szRxLen, int timeout);

00145   int (*target_receive_bits)(struct nfc_device *pnd, uint8_t *pbtRx, const size_t szRxLen, uint8_t *pbtRxPar);

00163 struct nfc_user_defined_device {

00165   nfc_connstring connstring;
00166   bool optional;
00167 };

00174 struct nfc_context {
00175   bool allow_autoscan;
00176   bool allow_intrusive_scan;
00177   uint32_t  log_level;
00178   struct nfc_user_defined_device user_defined_devices[MAX_USER_DEFINED_DEVICES];
00179   unsigned int user_defined_device_count;
00180 };

00189 struct nfc_device {

00211   int     last_error;
00212 };
